title: Daily reminder, Ignite now does 505 damage at level 18, 300 or so at level 12
body: It does more than some ultimates, why should a summoner spell have this much power. I don't even see TP anymore in top lane, just people taking ignite. It's not even laning phase anymore, it's who can get who in ignite kill range first

So much damage, so much broken shit and not enough resistances or defensive mechanisms deal with it all.. But Bone Plating is OP according to Rito, that's why it got nerfed like 2 times or even more, hell I lost count.

I have to take that rune 100% of the time just so I can hopefully survive all the burst damage that's available  at the start and throughout the entire game.

But Bone Plating OP. The fact that a champion can deal 400dmg+ (Even if you take Bone Plating) to you at level 1 with one trade because they have Electrocute (Riven) is perfectly fine!

And I'm not the one to bitch/moan about champions being busted, if I have a problem with a champion I usually just ban them 100% of the time but I never had so many problems with a certain group of champions until this season and it's not cus they busted, it's cus the runes are busted.

Sorry for digressing, but I hear ya OP. Ignite is pretty strong atm and it's just more overkill and beating dead horses since we have so much dmg from runes anyway.
Not sure why bone plating is considered op, just one auto harass in between farming and it has prevented 0 damage and will be on cd for the next 45 sec.

> [{quoted}](name=Bobloser3555,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=95cbGOuF,comment-id=00070000,timestamp=2018-08-09T21:38:56.123+0000)
>
> Not sure why bone plating is considered op, just one auto harass in between farming and it has prevented 0 damage and will be on cd for the next 45 sec.

I don't know why either, it was a very good rune when it first came out but since its release they nerfed it 2 or more times. That rune is 100% required if you play solo, the level of damage you take pre-6 is ludicrous, as if it was already bad enough the damage just gets even more bogus at later portions of the game. 

It's very disheartening and discouraging to have legit 6 tank items and still get blown to shreds in less then 2 seconds. The effectiveness of resistances have hit rock bottom in this season.

EDIT - When Bone Plating first came out it last 5 seconds and reduced damage by 20-50. Since then it was nerfed twice, reducing the time to 3 seconds after dmg and reduced damage 15-40. So I have to say that was a pretty big nerf, but Electrocute is fine. Being able to take 20% true damage is fine. Taking 1.5k+ true damage in a team fight that last 5 seconds is fine, bone plating NOT FINE.

From my experience Bone Plating is overrated as hell. It used to actually be OP, but it is now something that isn't even worth picking most of time. Peharps against Riven or Pantheon or something with a cheesy early game. But otherwise it is meh and you are better off picking an offensive rune, especially one that doesn't fall off as hard late game.

It is especially terrible against ranged champions, which have an even easier time procing it with one auto then backing off.

Not to mention, if you are one of those champions that pick Conqueror or Press the Attack, and pick Bone Plating, you are getting no AD from your runes, which means, you have a harder time last hitting.

It's a must have in top lane, you can probably opt out of it if your in a tank match up since they lack the early killing power but when laning against some of the most common top laners having Bone Plating determines a lot in a trade outcome. If you have bone plating and they don't, you win the trade. If you both have bone plating the trade then your skill/kit relativity to theirs determines who wins, if you don't have bone plating and they do you will lose every trade unless they mess up or absolutely suck.

If you take Resolve as primary or secondary, Bone Plating is something you will take 90% of the time because there are no better choices and the fact that it gives you enough survivability to live through some of the burst it's a no brainer, you have to take it. 

The only time I would forgo this rune is if I was playing with silver or bronze players. I'm by no means the best player in the world but I am playing with Plat 4,5 and  Gold 1, 2 players who are actually pretty decent and not taking Bone Plating pretty much makes me useless during lane phase.

The issue with it was that it was so much better than the other runes in the tree there was never any reason to take them.
Was nerfing it instead of making other defensive runes actually useful the right call? I'm leaning  toward no.
Because it's the only actual defense rune in the game available at level 1.
I dont even take bone plating anymore. I tried Yorick out for 3 games in normal matches, on the third I just ended up takin demolish. Bone plating is just a minor annoyance to the enemy at this point

Be serious. If you take teleport over ignite you are planning to safely farm and look for opportunities to tp roam. If you get ganked or die, you have an instant ticket back to lane.

You aren't supposed to be able to aggressively out duel an opponent wielding ignite while you have teleport. If you could, then ignite wouldn't be doing it's job and everyone would go back to how it was previously, taking teleport 90 percent of the time.

That's what I meant by having your cake and eating it. Choose to have more opportunities for an aggressive lane with ignite or to enjoy all of the benefits of teleport while adjusting to a weaker all in during the laning phase, not both.

Because if you take ignite, get ganked, and die, you will straight up lose your tower if the jungler sticks around and its past 7 minutes. Yes, you can get repeat ganked if you tp, but if you have teleport there is a MUCH higher chance your jungler will be there to contest knowing you will also be there. If you don't have tp and you die there is next to no reason for me to attempt to contest that tower unless I am fed because it will instead be me getting dove while you are still running back to lane.

Not to mention my ignite comes back faster than your TP meaning I can kill you again and get further ahead. This is an early game meta boy. If you win early, chances are you'll win. That's lane done. The problem with TP is that it's a high-risk ability because you have to think about when to use/hold it. This decision used to be easier when it had reduced cd when you TP on a minion and it had a wayy lower CD. But now, it's not. You're absolutely right! Resolve runes suck monkey balls! You literally have 1 choice in every tier. Bone Plating, Second Wind / Chrysalis is decent, Overgrowth and MAYBE Unflinching but I find the Precision Tenacity to be vastly superior.

Basically you have to take all the runes that help you survive burst and sustain as long as possible or you lose the lane, but even then it's not always enough, the damage ultimately engulfs everything.

Conditioning needs a buff, Font of Life could use some work because it's basically a support only rune, and Unflinching/Revitalize need to be looked at. Personally I feel the value I get from Unflinching/Revitalize is too low for them to be worth taking.

Actually, the only Rune pages that are viable are Domination, Precision and Inspiration.

In Sorcery and Resolve most tiers have one legit rune.

Just look at second row of Sorc. Nullifying - Manaflow - Nimbus. And now imagine, you play a Rumble or a Vlad vs AD. You are literally stricted to one viable choice. This is BS. Old masteries at least had something to offer.

And they removed Iron Skin/Mirror shell or wharever was it called. You had choices to get Armor, MR or both. But yeah, ruin tanks because they were tanky. And now look at a Domination or Precision row. You have a choice to get Healing from ability/Movement speed/item CDR or Ult CDR from unique takedows. You have options to choose from. And not to talk about the Legend Stacks row in Precision. (THEY PUT A BONUS TENACITY RUNE INTO THE ADC RUNE PAGE WTF)

The best thing they could do is to revert this whole Runes Reforged, and bring back the old Masteries.
